item.title: PD: Attention, memory and aphasia: Implications
item.description: Tags: #aphasia #language Code: O Type: Live online event (Past event) Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub Description: Evidence from aphasia literature supports the proposition that cognitive processes, such as attention and memory, influence language production and comprehension.

item.title: PD: Dysphagia management and risk feeding in aged or palliative care
item.description: Tags: #dysphagia #riskfeeding #agedcare #pallcare Code: O Type: Live online event (Nov 2022) (Runs over 2 sessions) Cost: $110 Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

item.title: PD: Implementing the National Guideline for the Diagnosis of ASD
item.description: Tags: #autism Code: O Type: Self-paced online course (4 hours to complete) Cost: $75 Website: Speech Pathology Australia — Learning Hub

item.title: PD: Infant feeding foundations workshop
item.description: Tags: #swallowing Code: O Type: Live online event or self-paced Cost: $350 Website: Babble & Munch Learning Description: This is an online workshop that teaches the developmental foundations of:

item.title: PD: Key Word Sign
item.description: Tags: #aac #sign Code: O Type: Blended and in-person Cost: $200 Website: Key Word Sign Australia Description: Key Word Sign is a tool or strategy which can be used to support children and adults with communication difficulties to understand and get their message across to others.

item.title: PD: Lidcombe Program
item.description: Tags: #stuttering Code: O Type: Online Cost: $500 Website: Lidcombe Program Trainers Consortium Description: The Lidcombe Program is an evidence based, behavioural treatment for early stuttering.

item.title: PD: LSVT Loud
item.description: Tags: #speech #voice #progneuro #dysarthria #congenital Code: O Type: In-person or online certification Some free webinars Website: LSVT Website

item.title: PD: PROMPT
item.description: Tags: #cas #autism #congenital #speech Code: O Type: Online or in-person Website: The PROMPT Institute Description: PROMPT is widely accepted as a treatment method for children ages 6 months and older who may have autism, apraxia, dysarthria, cerebral palsy, or other motor speech disorders.

item.title: PD: Sounds Write
item.description: Tags: #literacy #language #dyslexia Code: O Type: Live online workshops (Feb 2023) Website: SPELD NSW Description: Sounds-Write is an evidence-based highly structured, synthetic, linguistic phonics program utilising an exciting and highly successful approach to the teaching of reading and spelling.

item.title: PD: Talk for Writing
item.description: Tags: #language #literacy Code: O Type: Live online workshops (Mar 2023) Website: Dyslexia — SPELD Foundation Description: Talk for Writing is a unique process that uses spoken activities to develop writing skills.
